p: In the case of vitamin E (“tocopherol”), Hategekimana et al. [ 104] applied nanoemulsion technology to obtain nanocapsules made with octenyl succinic anhydride starches as emulsifiers and wall materials [ 105]. This vitamin E loaded-nanocapsules could be applied in the pharmaceutical and beverage sector. Dasgupta et al. [ 82] produced vitamin E nanoemulsions by edible mustard oil and Tween 80 as a surfactant. Double emulsions can be another way for nanoencapsulating BACs [ 106].
